intro: Hieracium pseudogrovesianum subsp. opertum, commonly known as the opertum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
